revised_title: Anatomy and Affinities of Heliopora cerulea and Xenia Species
tldr: The author examines the structure and affinities of Heliopora cerulea and compares it to the genus Xenia, discussing their skeletal structures, endodermic canals, and coenenchymal coeca. The study also introduces the concept of Cainothecalia, a new class of corals with interconnected corallites, and provides a comparison to Autothecalia, which have separate and distinct corallites.
